activities.description: Task: Connect approval queue to MCP — persist approvals to approvals.json
activities.details: Currently hw_check_approval writes to activity.json only. The ApprovalQueue UI reads from an in-memory Zustand store that is never populated from the file system. Fix: MCP server should write pending approvals to .hello-world/approvals.json. Frontend reads via get_approvals Tauri command + useTauriData hook, populates the Zustand store. Approve/Reject buttons write resolution back to file.

activities.description: [PAIN] Approval Queue is fully disconnected from MCP server
activities.details: The ApprovalQueue UI component reads from a Zustand in-memory store (useActivityStore.approvals). This store is never populated from the file system. The MCP tool hw_check_approval writes an activity event to .hello-world/activity.json but does NOT write to any approvals file. The frontend has no Tauri command for reading approvals, no useTauriData hook for approvals, and no file watcher connection to the approval store. The result: the bottom approval bar always shows "No pending approvals" regardless of what Claude requests. Approve/Reject buttons exist in the UI but are functionally dead. Fix requires: (1) MCP server writes pending approvals to .hello-world/approvals.json with status field, (2) new Rust Tauri command get_approvals reads that file, (3) frontend polls it via useTauriData and syncs into Zustand store, (4) Approve/Reject buttons call a set_approval_status Tauri command that writes the resolution back to file so the MCP tool can read it and unblock.
